net.grinder.script
Interface Statistics

public interface Statistics

Script statistics reporting API.

An implementation of this interface can be obtained using Grinder.ScriptContext.getStatistics(). This can be used in a script to query the result of the last test. For example: 

       result1 = test1.doSomething()
       timeTaken1 = grinder.statistics.time

       if grinder.statistics.success:
         # ...

By default, test statistics reports are automatically sent to the console and data log when the test implementation returns to the script, so the script cannot modify the test statistics. By using setDelayReports(boolean), scripts can turn off this automatic reporting for the current worker thread. Having done this, the script can modify or set the statistics before they are sent to the log and the console. The statistics reports are sent at a later time as described in setDelayReports(boolean)below. For example: 

       grinder.statistics.delayReports = 1

       result1 = test1.doSomething()

       if isFailed(result1):

          # Mark test as failure. The appropriate failure detection
          # depends on the type of test.
         grinder.statistics.success = 0

It is possible to set the statistics from within test implementation itself. This is more useful for user statistics than for the standard statistics (e.g untimedTests,errors) as the standard statistics may be overridden by The Grinder engine when the test finishes.

For a list of the standard statistics, see StatisticsIndexMap.

There is currently no script interface for updating sample statistics. Currently the only sample statistic is timedTests.

Author:
Philip Aston
See Also:

Method Detail

setDelayReports

public void setDelayReports(boolean b)
Use to delay reporting of the last test statistics to the log and the console so that the script can modify them. Normally test statistics are reported automatically when the test implementation returns.

With this set to true the test statistics will be reported at the following times:

  1. When the next test is invoked.
  2. When the current run completes.
  3. When the script calls report().
  4. When the script calls setDelayReports(false).

Parameters:
b - false => enable automatic reporting when tests return (the default behaviour); true => delay reporting.
See Also:
report()

report

public void report()
            throws InvalidContextException
Send the last test statistics to the data log and the console. If called from within the test implementation, this will cause the statistics to be sent when the test returns.

Calling this does nothing if the statistics have already been reported.

Throws:
InvalidContextException - If called from a different thread to the thread in which the Statistics was was acquired, or before the first test.
See Also:
availableForUpdate()

availableForUpdate

public boolean availableForUpdate()
Return whether the statistics for the current test are available for update. If this returns true, then other methods will not throw InvalidContextException.

Returns:
Whether the statistics for the current test are available for update.

setValue

public void setValue(StatisticsIndexMap.LongIndex index,
                     long value)
              throws InvalidContextException
Sets the long statistic with index index to the specified value for the last test.

Parameters:
index - The statistic index.
value - The value.
Throws:
InvalidContextException - If called from a different thread to the thread in which the Statistics was was acquired.
InvalidContextException - If called before the first test.
InvalidContextException - If called when the statistics have already been sent for the last test performed by this thread - see setDelayReports(boolean) and availableForUpdate().

setSuccess

public void setSuccess(boolean success)
                throws InvalidContextException
Convenience method that sets whether the last test should be considered a success or not.

When the statistics are reported (see report()):

  • If errors is 0 and the process is recording time, the elapsed time of the test is added to the timedTest statistic.
  • If errors is 0 and the process is not recording time, untimedTests is set to 1.
  • If errors is 1 the timedTests and untimedTests statistics are not altered.

Parameters:
success - If true errors is set to 0, otherwise errors is set to 1.
Throws:
InvalidContextException - If called from a different thread to the thread in which the Statistics was was acquired.
InvalidContextException - If called before the first test.
InvalidContextException - If called when the statistics have already been sent for the last test performed by this thread - see setDelayReports(boolean)and availableForUpdate().

getSuccess

public boolean getSuccess()
Convenience method that returns whether the last test was a success (errors is zero) or not.

Returns:
Whether the last test was a success.

getTime

public long getTime()
Convenience method that returns the time taken by the last test.

Returns:
The time for the last test.
